Selected Prior Experience

Lead Data Scientist / Sport Scientist — Sport Performance Analytics Inc. (2017–2025)
Modeling athlete fatigue and tactical behavior; introduced flow field, hyper-network, and topological braid models to quantify team and player dynamics; collaborated with national federations

Modeled functional connectivity and cognitive/motor performance using graph theory, information theory, and control systems; integrated eye-tracking & motion capture technologies
Research Assistant — University of Toronto (2018–2021)
Gait event detection, data fusion, and mobile diagnostics in clinical biomechanics; modeling teaching discourse & 4D fMRI analysis in numerical cognition

title: Projects
text:
Quantitative Head-Injury Mapping Using geometry-aware manifold learning to quantify the latent relationship between 3D head-impact exposure and white matter microstructural changes using joint multidimensional scaling and Wasserstein metrics


SNN Neuromorphic Motion Tracking Implementing a spiking neural network (LIF) in Nengo to emulate the visual processing pathway, utilizing Kalman filters for optimal sensorimotor integration during a multiple object tracking task.

title: Projects
text:
Mathematical modeling in sport


 Topological Dynamics Quantifying team coordination and tactical behavior through the lens of algebraic braid theory.


 Hyper-network Analysis Modeling multi-agent passing strategies using higher-order network science to identify hidden tactical structures.


 Vector Fields Analyzing team “tempo” and spatial synchronization using divergence waves and spatiotemporal intensity metrics.


 Coordination Manifolds Extracting low-dimensional movement manifolds from high-dimensional kinematic data to classify elite sprint mechanics.

title: Abdullah Zafar
text:
I develop computational frameworks to understand how mechanical stress and injury reshape brain structure, movement, and physiological regulation. My work bridges head impact exposure, neuroimaging, and multimodal wearable data to reveal the latent dynamics of injury, adaptation, and recovery.
